channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Rubbish not collected for over 2 weeks, 30th January
item.description:
Rubbish has not been collected for over 2 weeks, it is communal waste and we know that there are road works ongoing and will be for months, but we need both the normal waste and the cardboard waste removed form the communal bins.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 10, Anerley Park, Crystal Palace, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Hole in Fence, 30th January
item.description:
The metal chain fence that runs a long kings meadow park and the railway line has a gap were a dog could get through as this is a safety factor please can you mend it
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lawn Close, Sundridge, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street light not working The Fairway near junction of Southborough Lane, 30th January
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): The Fairway, Southborough, Greater London

item.title: Parked with no mot, 30th January
item.description:
Part of the t&c of the estate permit states must have a valid mot, bmw has not moved for 2 months and no valid mot taking up valuable space

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 23, Paradise Street, Bermondsey, Greater London

item.title: Security post removed, 30th January
item.description:
Once again the security post next to security gate has been removed. The motorcyclist Do this to gain entry to St Paul’s cray hill park, Needs to be more robust posts deeper embedded.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Chapman's Lane, St Paul's Cray, Greater London

item.title: Street light, 30th January
item.description:

item.title: 76 Arsenal Road, SE9, 30th January
item.description:
Ongoing building works at 76 Arsenal road. Builders have broken several paving slabs outside the property. Builders have also not tidied up at all so pavement is covered in mud which has now become slippery and dangerous with teh wet weather.Building materials are often blocking street overbnight. Builders have also left cement/gravel in the road gully which is blocking the drainage.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Arsenal Road, Eltham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping and ripped rubbish bags on Lee road, 30th January
item.description:
Consistent fly tipping and rubbish bags being left at the rubbish bin on Lee road in front of our business, Chiropractic Health Centre. Foxes are now ripping bags apart.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Lee Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Oil spill, 30th January
item.description:
Someone has dumped a large container of used oil outside 310 Walworth road. It has leaked all over the pavement and into the road. Someone has attempted to cover it with flattened cardboard boxes but it is very dangerous to pedestrians, bikes and traffic
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 314, Walworth Road, Walworth, Greater London
